meanings.definition: The concentration or potency of a substance, such as a drug or antibody, as determined by a specific test.
meanings.sent1: The titre of the medicine was measured carefully before administration.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician recorded the titre of the solution in the report.
meanings.sent3: The scientist accidentally spilled the high titre liquid, creating a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like a strong titre, driving her towards her goals.
meanings.sent5: The bright red colour of the solution indicated its high titre level.

meanings.definition: A title or heading of a document or section.
meanings.sent1: The titre of the book chapter caught the reader's attention.
meanings.sent2: Please include the correct titre on the cover page of your report.
meanings.sent3: The funny titre of the story made everyone laugh out loud.
meanings.sent4: His name shone like a golden titre on the front page of the newspaper.
meanings.sent5: The bold and large font of the titre made it easy to find in the document.

meanings.definition: A mark or symbol used in music to indicate pitch.
meanings.sent1: The musician carefully noted the correct titre on the musical score.
meanings.sent2: The song's titre helped the singer hit the high notes perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The playful titre on the sheet music made the pianist smile.
meanings.sent4: Her voice soared like a beautiful musical titre in the concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The clear and precise titre guided the orchestra during the performance.
